songs.description: All of my songs are from shows I saw live this year - one song per show. This was at baby's all right and this song in particular was so good live. It was a really small crowd and she was down off the stage for a lot of it. Everyone knew the words to this one.
Second time seeing Liv.e this year (she was my most played artist I think). This one was outside at knockdown center.
I don't usually listen to this kind of music day to day but this was a really magical show. Very hard to put into words the way this show felt besides being just very beautiful and otherworldly.
I wanted to see CLIP for a while - I think her music is so different but goes so hard.
454's music has so much style and energy. This was the same show CLIP played at.
Prospect park bandshell - Liv.e was the opener. I remember walking up to this show hearing it from afar and you could feel her energy. Everyone there was so hot.

This was the main act at the Prospect Park bandshell that Liv.e opened for. Incredible. She had this really flowy dress/hood on and just stood there, lit up into a silhouette with the wind blowing over her and you could feel all these pulsing low frequency sounds.

My friend loves Olivia but this was my first time seeing/listening. It felt like watching something important happening. She was so cool, relaxed, beautiful, funny in those little awkward spaces between songs.

Favorite show of the year no question. The whole production was wild. There was so much dopamine/serotonin released I think I felt high for a month after. This was also my first stadium-sized show and it was in the middle of the summer, I think adding to all the effects.
This show felt so fitting to be at king's theater in brooklyn. The music felt very haunting, elaborate, mysterious.
My friends and I started going to this place that would put on small house shows in brooklyn. This song sounded like such a hit even the first time hearing it.
Same venue as the previous but different show. I liked their vibe a lot, it felt like a different era of music.
This was a bigger show than the first time I saw her. She explained this song was about her grandma and some of her family members were in the crowd in front of us - it was a very cute moment.
Sampha was sitting at the piano for this song which I kind of didn't expect but the performance was really good. The drummer went off. My favorite song on his album.

I had never consciously listened to LCD Soundsystem before seeing them this December so I was surprised at how many songs I knew. Such a fun show all around. I feel like the year ended on a really good note with this.
